Our Project
Title: Analysis of Key Performance Indicators and Squad Market Values Impacting Rankings in Turkey’s Süper Lig: A Focus on Shooting Accuracy, Possession, and Goals (2015-2024)
Description:
This project analyzes how key performance indicators—such as average shots, average shots on target, average ball possession, average goals scored, average goals conceded, squad market values, and team rankings—have influenced the performance of Turkey’s top football teams in the Süper Lig over the past 9 seasons (2015-2024). The study examines the relationships between offensive and defensive metrics, market value of players, and their direct impact on league rankings. By incorporating squad market values, the project explores how a team’s financial strength and player quality contribute to overall success. Key visualizations, including trend analysis, bar chart races, and correlation graphs, illustrate the effect of these variables on team performance. The analysis aims to uncover patterns of success, identify underperforming areas, and provide actionable insights into the factors most strongly determining a team’s position in the league standings.

Turkish Super League Stats for top 4 teams, The period between 2015-2016 and 2023-2024

title: The Data
text:
Our data consists of information from the last 9 years, including the following metrics:

Average Ball Possession
Average Shots
Average Shots on Target
Average Goals Scored
Average Goals Conceded
Squad Market Values
Rankings

This dataset provides a comprehensive overview of key performance indicators and squad financial data for the past nine seasons.
Data source: Transfermarkt, Sofascore and Footystats



Before importing the dataset, we manually cleaned it by removing unnecessary data to eliminate irrelevant information.




# Load necessary libraries
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)

# Define the path to your Excel file
file_path <- "superligstats.xlsx"

# Get sheet names
sheet_names <- excel_sheets(file_path)

# Read all sheets and merge them into one dataframe
merged_data <- lapply(sheet_names, function(sheet) {
  read_excel(file_path, sheet = sheet)
}) %>% bind_rows()

Turkish Super League Stats for top 4 teams, The period between 2015-2016 and 2023-2024



In our project, we are working with a dataset sourced from Transfermarkt, FootyStats, and SofaScore, focusing on key performance indicators in Turkey’s Süper Lig from 2015 to 2024. The data includes detailed information on average ball possession, average shots, average shots on target, average goals scored, average goals conceded, squad market values, and team rankings. This comprehensive dataset allows us to analyze trends, relationships, and the impact of performance metrics and market values on team rankings over the past nine seasons.
